title: Leading Change in Global Development in an Era of Disruption
description: This course is intended for students contemplating careers in management or policy formation in public or private development assistance organizations. It focuses particularly on the change management processes of the major professional sectors and organizations that make up the overall global development assistance ecosystem. It reviews the major external trends in global development, as well as the dynamics of the major development actors as they respond to these new forces. The course then applies this analysis to the change strategies and activities of specific organizations, examining how leaders successfully or unsuccessfully manage the intersection between new external realities and their current organizational situation. Regardless of development field of individual interest—management and administration, policy and advocacy, medicine, health, nutrition, or environmental sustainability—most young professionals find their future careers significantly influenced by the impact of organizational response to disruptive change. It is the hypothesis of this seminar that the capacity of professionals to understand and positively influence these organizational dynamics is central to achieving results in any of the professional fields in development assistance.
